title: Challenge 2 · Values Recognition
summary: Guide participants through a two-person comparison so they can see the dominant value signals inside their team before the AI Coach reflects the pattern.

teammateSlots.label: Person A
teammateSlots.helperText: First teammate you want to understand or support.

checklistPrompt: Tick every behaviour that you have observed for each teammate. Use the watchouts sparingly—they indicate when a value family is under stress.

valueFamilies.label: Sva-Artha
valueFamilies.description: Movement, impact, achievement, autonomy, power and ambition.

values.label: Achievement
signals: Sets clear, challenging goals and tracks progress.
Regularly seeks feedback to improve performance.
Celebrates success milestones and personal wins.

values.label: Autonomy
signals: Takes initiative and makes decisions without waiting for approval.
Encourages team members to act independently.
Manages time and priorities proactively.
watchouts: Rejects feedback or collaboration, insisting on solo control.

values.label: Power
signals: Influences stakeholders to align with strategic vision.
Makes bold decisions even under uncertainty.
Sets direction confidently and motivates others.
watchouts: Uses authority to intimidate or dominate rather than empower.

values.label: Ambition
signals: Pursues stretch targets beyond current capabilities.
Engages in continuous learning and self-development.
Inspires others with passionate vision for the future.
watchouts: Sacrifices team morale for personal advancement.

valueFamilies.coachInterpretation: High selections in Sva-Artha indicate a teammate who thrives on autonomy, pace and visible movement. They respond well to clarity, stretch goals and equanimity (Upeksha) when challenged.

valueFamilies.label: Sva-Raksha
valueFamilies.description: Discipline, compliance, reliability and stability—protecting what works.

values.label: Discipline
signals: Sticks to routines and commitments.
Demonstrates self-control in high-pressure moments.
Prioritizes important tasks over urgent distractions.
watchouts: Becomes rigid and inflexible, stifling creativity and spontaneity.

values.label: Compliance
signals: Adheres to policies and regulatory standards.
Gently reminds the team of rules when overlooked.
Reports non-compliance respectfully to maintain standards.

values.label: Reliability
signals: Delivers on commitments consistently and on time.
Keeps stakeholders informed about status updates.
Follows through on promises made to colleagues.
watchouts: Micromanages or becomes controlling to ensure every detail aligns.

values.label: Stability
signals: Remains calm during organizational change.
Promotes predictable processes in teams.
Provides steady guidance in uncertain times.
watchouts: Resists necessary change, becoming stuck in old, unproductive patterns.

valueFamilies.coachInterpretation: When Sva-Raksha dominates, the teammate is protecting order. Meet them with Karuna (compassion)—respect what they safeguard before inviting experimentation.

valueFamilies.label: Sva-Prerana
valueFamilies.description: Integrity, accountability, fulfillment and competence—inner fire that wants to uplift meaningfully.

values.label: Integrity
signals: Makes transparent decisions aligned with core values.
Admits mistakes and takes responsibility publicly.
Upholds ethical standards, even when it's difficult.

values.label: Accountability
signals: Sets clear deadlines and owns performance metrics.
Reviews outcomes and takes corrective actions.
Holds oneself and others responsible for results.
watchouts: Becomes self-blaming or excessively harsh on mistakes, creating guilt culture.

values.label: Fulfillment
signals: Chooses work aligned with personal meaning.
Brings in fun and excitement at work.
Coaches others toward meaningful milestones.
watchouts: Over-focus on personal satisfaction leads to avoidance of discomfort or growth areas.

values.label: Competence
signals: Shows strong subject-matter knowledge in discussions.
Quickly solves problems using expertise.
Shares knowledge to uplift team capability.
watchouts: Looks down on others who may not be as competent.

valueFamilies.coachInterpretation: If Sva-Prerana wins, the teammate seeks meaning plus mastery. Lead with Maitri (loving-kindness)—offer respect, curiosity and co-design.

valueFamilies.label: Aatma-Siddhi
valueFamilies.description: Compassion, oneness, detachment and the greater good—purpose beyond ego.

values.label: Compassion
signals: Actively listens and acknowledges emotional cues.
Offers help or flexibility when someone is struggling.
Checks in on colleagues' wellbeing.

values.label: Oneness
signals: Frames decisions around collective impact.
Encourages cross-functional collaboration.
Emphasizes shared vision and unity.
watchouts: Seeks consensus at all costs, possibly suppressing dissent.

values.label: Detachment
signals: Considers multiple perspectives before reacting.
Maintains emotional balance in stressful situations.
Focuses on long-term objectives rather than immediate outcomes.
watchouts: Becomes emotionally aloof and is seen as uncaring.

values.label: Greater Good
signals: Prioritizes initiatives benefiting the whole organization or community.
Advocates for ethical and sustainable practices.
Mentors others to develop a broader positive impact.
watchouts: Becomes overly idealistic and loses focus on key goals.

valueFamilies.coachInterpretation: Dominant Aatma-Siddhi signals quiet, purpose-driven strength. Respond with Mudita (joy in another’s goodness)—invite them to influence without overpowering them.

instructions: Count the number of observed behaviours ticked within each value family for Person A and Person B.
The family with the highest tally becomes the teammate's primary quadrant; ties can be displayed as dual orientations.
Watchouts can reduce confidence—if only stress behaviours are selected, flag it for a qualitative follow-up.
scoringModel.tieBreaker: Show both families and ask the participant which one feels more accurate.

reflectionPrompts: Which value family felt surprisingly strong for each teammate?
Where might you need more evidence or a conversation before labelling someone?
guidance: As you place tick marks against behaviours Person A and Person B demonstrate, you will be able to see which category of values they demonstrate more. If you need to have a confirmatory call with them, feel free to have a conversation.

conceptPanel.caption: Values Recognition Grid
conceptPanel.callout: Highlight the quadrant that aligns with the highest tally for each teammate.
